required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ketogenic Diet in PCOS With Obesity and Insulin Resistance
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Very Low Calorie Ketogenic Diet on Obese and Insulin-resistant Women With Polycystic Ovary Syndrome: a Controlled Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the VLCKD randomized clinical trial is to demonstrate the superiority of very low calorie ketogenic diet with respect to the standard low calorie diet in reducing body weight and insulin resistance in obese and insulin resistant patients with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome

primary_outcome.time_frame: 16 weeks after the start of treatment
primary_outcome.description: Weight and height will be combined to report BMI in kg/m^2

primary_outcome.measure: Change in body composition measured by bioimpedentiometry
primary_outcome.time_frame: 16 weeks after the start of the treatment
primary_outcome.description: Fat mass and lean mass changes will be considered to estimate change in body composition and reported as %

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 weeks after the start of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Weight and height will be combined to report BMI in kg/m^2

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in body composition measured by bioimpedentiometry
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 weeks after the start of the treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Fat mass and lean mass will be considered to estimate change in body composition and reported as %

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Homeostasis Model Assessment Index
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 16 weeks after the start of the treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Fasting glucose in mmol/L and fasting insulin in mcU/mL will be combined to report Homeostasis Model Assessment Index

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in frequency of menstrual cycles
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 16 weeks after the start of the treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Number of menses in the 16 weeks before will be considered to report the frequency of menstrual cycles

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 16 weeks after the start of the treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Modified Ferriman-Gallwey score will be used to measure changes in hirsutism; the minimum and maximum values are 4 and 36 respectively; higher score means a worse outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in plasma concentrations of testosterone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 16 weeks after the start of the treatment
secondary_outcome.description: testosterone will be reported in ng/mL

arm_group.description: Dietary intervention with a very low calorie ketogenic diet, using commercial products of the Pronokal PnK® method
Control treatment with a low calorie standard diet

intervention.description: Dietary intervention with a very low calorie ketogenic diet, using commercial products of the Pronokal PnK® method
Low calorie standard diet with no specified dietary supplement addition

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- PCOS according to the NIH criteria;
- Body mass index (BMI) between 30 and 35 kg/m3;
- HOMA index ≥ 3 (according to formula: (fasting glucose [mmol/L] × fasting insulin [mIU/L])/22.5)
- Written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes type 1
- Exogenous insulin or insulin analogue therapy
- Obesity caused by endocrine disease other than PCOS
- Obesity caused by pharmacotherapy
- Use of a weight-loss diet in the past 3 months
- Use of contraceptive pills in the past 3 months
- Severe depression
- Other psychiatric diseases
- Alcohol or psychoactive substance abuse
- Severe hepatic insufficiency
- Renal calculosis
- Renal insufficiency
- Episodes of gout
- Malignant neoplasia
- Previous cardiovascular or cerebrovascular events
- Uncontrolled hypertension
- Water-electrolyte imbalance
- Any pharmacotherapy capable of interfering with glucose metabolism
- Any pharmacotherapy capable of interfering with steroid metabolism
- Menopause
- Pregnancy
- Lactation.

facility.name: Unit of Endocrinology and Prevention and Care of Diabetes, S.Orsola Hospital
